sourceOfFunds.purpose: With this financial support of the Sangeet Natak Akademi, we revived a 100-year old dance-drama troupe. After this, the troupe gave their performances in many prestigious theater festivals of the country.

detailsOfAchievement: Bihar Voluntary Health Association has been engaged in Community Health Promotion in Bihar through Voluntary Action since 1969. It is the oldest secular health network of India and is the largest NGO network in Bihar. It is federated with voluntary health association of India. During last 41 years of its establishment, it has carried out many health and development activities in each and every corner of Bihar with the help of its network member originations. It has been working with support of MOH&FW, GOI and Govt. of Bihar, national and international donor agencies, its network member organizations, VHAI and individual following major activities were carried out by BVHA till date as mentioned below: 1. Community health intervention through networking advocacy and support to voluntary organizations in the state of Bihar. 2. Reproductive and Child Health Awareness Project as MNGO. 3. Capacity Building Project of VOs on Community Health Management. 4. Diarrhea management in the slums of Patna district. 5. Support to gender issues programme 6. ISM&H (IEC) programme of MOH&FW, GOI. 7. Community radio programme on health and gender issues. 8. Tobacco awareness programme 9. Pluse polio search campaign 10. Adolescent Reproductive Health Training of girls and boys of 15-19 years. 11. Advocacy project to reduce IMR & MMR 12. Disaster Management programme 13. Arsenic Mitigation project 14. Promotion of rational use of drugs 15. Malaria control project 16. Kala-azar elimination project through behavior change communication 17. Challenge fund partnership project on HIV/AIDS awareness. 18. Advocacy intervention for improving quality care services at PHC level. 19. Capacity building of Zila Parishad, Panchaat Samiti and Gram Panchayat Members for effective implementation of HIV/AIDS intervention programme. 20. Integration health & nutrition programme 21. Community Awareness Building on Girl Child Survival and Conscientiousness Building on PC & PNDT through NGO intervention. 22. IMNCI training project for AWW, ANMs on integrated management of neonatal & childhood illnesses. 23. Communication initiatives to strengthen activities at community level. 24. Psycho-social Counseling Programme for Adolescent Girls and Women in four worst flood affected districts of Bihar. 25. Emergency child protection programme. 26. Medial relief camp during flood in Bihar. Major achievements: BVHA has developed capacities of more than 10000 stake holders in Bihar to handle community health programmes in Bihar. BVHA has helped Govt. of Bihar to carryout Massive Malaria Eradication programme in 6 districts of undivided Bihar.(presently in Jharkhand state) and as a result , death due to malaria came down to very minimum. BVHA also advocated continuously for proper implementation of activities by Govt. of Bihar under Tobacco Control programme and as result govt. of Bihar has formed State Tobacco Cell & initiated Tobacco Control activities in the State of Bihar. BVHA has saved thousands of thousands of lives at the time of disaster by providing timely medical services to the victims. With the continuous liaisoning & advocacy BVHA and its member organizations have become members of various govt. formed societies/boards where it takes active part in planning, strategy formulation and implementation part. ************************************

It aimed to build the capacity of college students, educated unemployed, housewifeâ€™s and businessman etc. â€¢Conservation of Indigenous traditional knowledge by promoting madhubani painting, handmade Jwellery products and handicraft products made up of cane, bamboo etc. at Darbhanga and Muzaffarpur disticts of Bihar. â€¢Sustainable livelihood promotion based on propagation of indigenous plant species (bamboo) at Jermundy Block, Dumka District, Jharkhand â€¢Meeting challenges of livelihood through jute cultivation in Godda block of Godda district of Jharkhand â€¢Organized Green Teacher programme of Centre for Environment Education (CEE), Ahmedabad and Vancuvor Agency , Canada in year 2006. â€¢One day seminar was organized to make aware the people about the ground water contamination and health hazards at Hasanpur block of Samastipur districts, Bihar on 14 October 2005 â€¢An awareness camp was organized to sensitize people of Jagdeo Path locality towards a mass plantation drive on 13 July 2006. â€¢Organized Human Chain and school competitions in association with Bihar State pollution Control Board (BSPCB), Patna and CEE on changing environmental conditions and its impact on public health by involving 10 National Green Corps Schools of Patna, at Government Boys High School, Shastri Nagar Patna on 7 April 2007. â€¢Achievements 1.Capacity building of 20 Teachers on Environment and sustainable development through Green teacher programme. 2.Provision of livelihood of about 500 families by their involvement in madhubani painting, handmade Jwellery products and handicraft products made up of cane, bamboo etc. in Darbhanga and Muzaffarpur districts of Bihar 3.Availability of livelihood resources for about 500 families and promoting biodiversity conservation through propagation of bamboo and Jute at Germundy block of Dumka district and Godda block of Godda district , Jharkhand. 4.Community level awareness and capacity building of 400 families for use of existing water and sanitation facilities in 3 panchayats of Hasanpur Block of Samastipur disrtict and 2 panchayats of Baheri block of Darbhanga district. 5.Provision of toilet facility to 300 families under total sanitation campaign (TSC) of Sarari Panchayat of Danapur block of Patna disrtict. Under this programme toilets will be provided to 500 more families in the same Panchayat. 6.Organised Entrepreneurship Development Programme(EDP) on Food Processing with the support of Ministry of Food Processing Industries, Govt. of India,New Delhi at Samastipur and Darbhanga districts of Bihar,Duration- May to June 2009.
